intro: Fimbristylis coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, linear leaves. Fimbristylis coarctata typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, often in freshwater habitats. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, contributing to its ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
